website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot Elph 115 IS compact camera isn't the best performer, but budget-minded shooters will appreciate its size and zoom range.
cons: Noisy images at moderate ISO settings

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this model for ease of use and because it's small enough to fit in my pocket. Have 3 of them now and keep one with me at all times. I bought the extra one because I'm afraid that this older model will eventually be hard to find or discontinued
customer_reviews.author: regina h

customer_reviews.title: AVOID - Not nearly as user friendly as earlier Canons
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say as I am a "Canon Guy," and I even bought THREE of these at once (Personal, Gift, Work related) and it's not nearly as user friendly as my similar Cannons from 2008, 2010, 2012 respectively. It's a memory hog - every photo shot is very large, making it hard and clunky to work with on regular computers and amateur softwares - the auto focus is not nearly as fast either... Only moderately user friendly. I'll be looking for something else before long sorry to say.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Buddy - Bud Fleisher

customer_reviews.title: I great point and shoot camera for my mom
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a gift. It was a replacement for the camera I purchased my Mom almost 10 years ago which was also a Canon PowerShot Elph (just a previous version). This camera is perfect for my 55 year old mother and nice replacement/improvement over her last camera. She likes that the buttons and setup are similar to her previous camera and also likes that she can remove the memory card and print photos at the kiosks at Target or Walmart. This camera takes nice quality photos and is very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera that takes good pictures
customer_reviews.text: My old kodak bit the dust and I needed a reasonable point and shoot camera. I saw this one and bought it. It does a remarkable job with most of the pictures I have taken. The port where the cable attaches is a bit cheesy but other than that, I like it. The battery charge lasts a long time It is not self explanatory from the description, but you must buy a cable separately From the Canon web page, this is what is in the box PowerShot ELPH 115 IS Wrist Strap WS-800 Battery Pack NB-11L Battery Charger CB-2L Here is a link to the cable
customer_reviews.author: Rick Grunwald

customer_reviews.title: Canon Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Canon man since I bought my first 35mm in 1970 while stationed in Viet Nam. I have bought this camera in preparation for my granddaughters 10th birthday. I am continuing a tradition started by my grandmother. She gave me her old 126 box camera when I was 10 and I have loved the frozen image since that day! My first granddaughter that reached 10 a couple of years ago LOVES hers and has signed up for the photography class in her junior high school!~DUG
customer_reviews.author: DUG

customer_reviews.title: Power shot
customer_reviews.text: Had a Canon before, liked the simplicity of using it. Finally didn't work right so bought another Canon. Still like it, does everything I need and can fit in my pocket when I"m not carrying a purse. Pixels are higher so my pictures do come out clearer and sharper.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapper

customer_reviews.title: nice and compact
customer_reviews.text: Works well, nice and compact, takes good pictures. I wanted a small camera that I could stick in my pocket while walking around on vacations, hikes, etc. My only complaint is that when you take a picture, review it, and then want to delete it, there is not a delete button/option to do that right there (like my old camera had). You have to go through like 3 different menus to eventually delete the picture. Kind of annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: La vie en bleu
customer_reviews.text: I have just received this camera and at the moment I have not enough information to be able to write about it. I wanted another compact to replace my old one I loved so much. All I can say about this one is that the colors seem to be more saturated than they used to. I like the lighter weight and blue color of this camera; it even seems smaller than my old pocket size one. However, I think the case and buttons look cheaper...but sincerely, it is incredible to get a new camera at such a price! I will write a little bit more about this camera once i am more familiar with it .
customer_reviews.author: VeroTop Contributor: Drawing

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous Packaging and Performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter to use as a member of her school's journalism class. She uses it to take pictures for the yearbook and school newsletter. My daughter has been amazed with the range provided by the camera's zoom capabilities. The pictures are very sharp and the camera's low weight makes it easy to hold the camera steady for video and pictures. The fact that it comes in pink was the clincher since that's my daughter's favorite color. I chose a Canon to minimize the risk that I would buy a camera that disappointed and camera again has delivered a quality camera at a great price. My daughter says it's the perfect camera for her.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good camera
customer_reviews.text: The options are standard for point & shoot camera. The megapixels are great. If you have steady hands this would likely be a great camera for you. It would have been a great camera, but the stability option didn't compensate for my shaky hands nearly enough. All the photos are blurry from camera shake. I wasn't expecting this much problem because I usually use a DSLR camera. I think the weight of a big camera, plus better stability options compensates for my problem with the DSLR. As it is, I gave this camera away because it was useless for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Russell

customer_reviews.title: I do not like the zoom mechanism at the button
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the zoom mechanism at the button. It is my first cannon that I do not like. Bummer. Of cameras in it's class I have owned Fuju, which was the cheapest and took the best pictures. It was a little bulkier though. A Nikon which was middle priced but I didn't really like the menus , and the pictures were not as good as the Fuji pics. The Nikon was not durable and despite light use fell apart after 2 years. The cannon, I was so excited about, being a Cannon girl, but this product is hard to use.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Granville

customer_reviews.title: BUY A CHEAPER CAMERA SO YOU CAN REPLACE IT EVERY SIX MONTHS!
customer_reviews.text: This camera was superb however it died after 11 months. Canon replaced it under warranty after multiple complaints however the replacement just died as well after 11 months. Better to buy a cheaper camera so that you can replace it every six months which is what I plan to do now! I have been a Canon camera owner for decades but I am done now.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: cannon in general, is a great company
customer_reviews.text: just fell apart 2 days from when i got in the mail. i did have square trade they cover nothing never buy a warranty on anything.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Dillion

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for an old Kodak camera. The canon has more pixels and optical tremor cancelling which is important since my wife has a mild tremor. The controls seem similar to my old camera and work fine. The zoom is hidden and could be easier to operate. We have been using it on basic 'point and shoot' settings and it seems to work well. Picture sharpness and color reproduction are an improvement on the old (still functional) camera.
customer_reviews.author: jl

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this small point and shoot camera to help me reach my goal for 2014- take a photo every day this year and document them in a photo album. So far- I love it. The quality of the photos once I put them on my computer are about what I expected- not as great as my husbands DSLR but better than that of my iPhone. Its so small and compact that its easy for me to fit in my purse (or pocket) and take everywhere which will be exactly what I need to accomplish my 365 pictures goal.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great for Everyday
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon Rebel T3i for special occasions, but for every day use, this little camera gives me great photos, and is so handy...and much better than my iphone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I got it for my mom because ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I got it for my mom because its easy to use. I have one for my self. I love these little canon powershot cameras. Ive dropped it and dented it and it still works great. It has a stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: vegas

customer_reviews.title: The Elph
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift for my GF. She loved the color, the size (fits in her purse without being bulky), and the picture quality was good for preserving those quick on the go memories; just zip it out of the bag, push a button, whir it springs to life and in just a fraction of a second the scene is preserved. As a side note, she asked me if I would mind her giving to her daughter for her birthday because she was becoming attached to the camera, the daughter is 10.
customer_reviews.author: David T. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for its price!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for its price. I bought it for work where I need something with a decent quality and not very expensive. Very satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Small but very good Camera.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is small but takes quality photos that are comparable to a larger camera. I have had friends ask what type of camera I use after viewing some of my photos and are pleasantly surprised when I show them my little PowerShot Elph 1515. It was a Christmas gift. I never leave home without it. I would recommend that you buy a sturdy camera case to protect your investment. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: S Key

customer_reviews.title: I love that this camera fits in my pocket
customer_reviews.text: I love that this camera fits in my pocket! It takes great pictures and is easy to use. It has great zoom, too. I don't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: uptown

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 16MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: Another great Canon product....This is not my first Canon camera...since going into the digital era I have enjoyed using Canon cameras...I tend to take thousands of pictures and like the simplicity and ease of using these cameras...for me this was an upgrade..I will purchase another when the time arises...it is small and fits easily any where ready for my use...rechargeable battery so you will have to remember to charge it up before a big event but it does hold the charge a long time...well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kkm

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of Canon products and ESPECIALLY their outstanding tech support, which they have kept in the U.S.- unlike MS and all the rest. I have a larger Canon, with 20x zoom and love it and their printers as well. Major kudos for Canon Tech support....the best. But, we were disappointed with this Elf; colors were washed out; poor result low light. Perhaps we were just unlucky, don't know. We got a Nikon Coolpix instead and are well pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Galina

customer_reviews.title: Great for adult videoing
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this one of the highest quality point and shoots I've ever owned. It's nice and has a very sleek yet matte feel. came with a battery (SUPER HELPFUL) it was great for shooting... um... adult videos. 10/10 would recommend! Remember to buy extra batteries and chargers!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Rose

customer_reviews.title: Decent Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed, maybe just because I thought I was "upgrading" my wife from an old ELPH 100HS to this. It is not a bad camera for the price at all, but the fit and finish feel plasticy. The battery sometimes get stuck in it's slot for example. Takes OK pictures. Just as I said not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Media1Mogul

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic digital camera
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for 11-year old granddaughter who is interested in photography. She had used an old Canon until it broke and was very excited to get her own new camera. She has already taken a ton of pictures and plans to take it on a trip with her soon.
customer_reviews.author: Collector

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Canon and have purchased many of their products in the past. I currently own the Canon PowerShot SX510 (which is amazing), but I wanted a small camera that I can carry in a wristlet, purse, or even pocket for impromptu shots. This camera is the perfect solution! It's compact and colorful, but it still takes amazing, high quality pictures and has a lot of features. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Image Quality Not up to Par
customer_reviews.text: The image quality on this camera is not as good as other Powershot Elphs. It does not focus well inside. There is a delay when pressing the button and taking a photo which is longer than the other Elphs. I spoke to Canon to find better image quality in a camera. Returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Candy

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera, for the price...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an unbelievable deal. The features on this camera are unbelievable at this price point. 8x optical zoom? Awesome! But there are some compromises. The autofocus on video can get squirrelly, especially in low-light. The camera is a little slow to respond, and the menu is a little cumbersome. But still a very solid camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: azfatboy

customer_reviews.title: What a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Husband wanted it and he really likes it. And this is one person who is fussy.. I recommend it highly as a easy to use camera. Only thing I didn't like was that there are no directions on how to use it in box, so I looked it up on the website of Cannon to get directions. This should be remedied because it is an excellent little camera. Glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Great Canon camera at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great Canon camera at a great price!! The ELPH 115is takes great photos, is very compact, and has many features. The image stabilization is remarkable on at camera at this price. This was a gift to my son as his first camera, and he is already taking great photos. Highly recommend this for anyone who is looking for a good quality compact camera.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Chr

customer_reviews.title: Improved picture quality/ease of use
customer_reviews.text: As we get each new model of the ELPH, we have noticed the picture quality improving and the camera is easier and easier to use with more and more features. It is an amazing piece of engineeirng. We used to require a viewfinder, but it is no longer a need. The screen is larger than the older models and easy to use. So far I cannot find any negatives about it.
customer_reviews.author: Milton N. Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Canon Quality
customer_reviews.text: This little Canon is absolutely perfect... It is small enough to fit in a purse or pocket, but the quality of the photos suggest an expensive camera. The photos are clear, the color is beautiful, and the shooting range is outstanding. The features are comparable to any larger point and shoot camera. I highly recommend this little gem.
customer_reviews.author: October

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for a teenage girl
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a 12 1/2 years old girl & she loves it. Canon is a good & reliable camera maker so I know that I made the right choice. The price of $99 seems to be reasonable. All & all, it's a decent camera for teenager who doesn't need lots of bells & whistles. It is also compact & light which makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Conscientious shopper

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Camera ELPH115IS
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed by Canon camera's and wanted a light weight camera. It takes great pictures, I ordered it on Dec 16, 2013 for myself. So far it has preformed great. However, when I removed the SD card then reinserted it, the card would not lock in and I couldn't close the cover where the battery and card are located. I am presently sending the camera out for repairs. It is suppose to be under warranty. I think I would of purchased two or three models up from this model.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene

customer_reviews.title: Short Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working suddenly after a little over a year of only occasional use. Pretty disappointed. It was great while it lasted, though. But it should've lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera for my daughter who is 6 for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera for my daughter who is 6 for her birthday. It's a really nice blue color and it's pretty easy for her to hold and take pictures with. It takes surprisingly good pictures for the price actually. I mean it's no 35mm camera - but for a cheap little quick shoot camera it is pretty awesome! Takes video too! Very happy with this purchase for my daughter. She really loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Mama

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic point-n-shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I keep a camera in the car for all opportunities and wanted to upgrade my Canon SD1200 and chose the PowerShot Elph 115. Cannot believe the wonderful image quality from this camera. So easy to use compared to my other six cameras. Love it and only paid $89 for it on sale. Perfect as my "sidekick" in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Herb Linamen

customer_reviews.title: Super cute!
customer_reviews.text: Just came in today. I've gotten some time to play with it a bit. It is cute and really attractive as far as cameras go. I had to put in a memory card before I could take any pictures and it didn't recognize the first one I put in, but I think that card is damaged. It did recognize the second one and takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Nickolas Morgaan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera. It's very simple to use. I've only taken a few pictures and I have not used the video yet. A carrying case is NOT included, so I had to buy one. It comes with a nice rechargeable battery and cord. It's about as good as you can get for the low price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Pink Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 16MP Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: A camera was my 10 year old granddaughter's request for her birthday. I really liked the color for a young girl's camera. She liked it as well. I have owned great Cannon cameras and this one is no exception. A great color choice for a camera for a girl who is preteen or young teen age.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne M.

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera because I needed something reasonably-priced to take pictures of jewelry for my business. So far, it's been one of my best purchase decisions! My favorite features are the automatic micro-focus and the anti-shake features which are great for shooting small earrings. Together they pick up all the details and I don't need a tripod. I also like the white balance feature because it allows me to take photos indoors without worrying about the "orange glow" that's so prominent under incandescent lighting. I really don't have any complaints so far. Surprisingly, I'm pretty thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: G. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Old models were better
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as previous models. This was my fourth Canon ELF camera. Works fine if the lighting is just right. Early models had a large range of adjustments to correct for any conditions. Fully zoomed the picture quality is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Accidental Hipster

customer_reviews.title: Such a great price for such a great camera
customer_reviews.text: Such a great price for such a great camera. Got it for my in laws because they were as always complaining about their year 2000 camera not working right and having to put batteries in it every time they took pictures. So the rechargeable battery is a huge Plus. And they love it. It's a month after Christmas and they are stuff thanking me for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jones

customer_reviews.title: pictures not very sharp
customer_reviews.text: I guess it's an okay camera for the size of it, but I really expected better quality from Canon. I'm using this one to replace my old Powershot 710 that finally kicked the bucket. But this Canon just doesn't have the clarity that the old camera had. I like the smaller design and the color is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: airportbabe

customer_reviews.title: nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 9-year-old, and she loves taking fun pictures with it. It's a great camera for that purpose - small, light, no fear of water drops... But if you're looking for professional quality, maybe it would not be a great choice, but for point-and-shoot purposes it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Tamuna

customer_reviews.title: Handy and user friendly
customer_reviews.text: i really like this little camera and will like it even better when i figure out all the features more. It has a nice feel in your hands and fits easily in a purse to carry. I have not yet figured out though how to attach that cord and don't see any directions. I think I know the tiny place it attaches but how to thread it through!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Utter

customer_reviews.title: You cannot get a better camera for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I would love an SLR, but they're too big. This is my 3rd one, I break them often because I take my camera everywhere, climbing, mtn biking, snowboarding, canyoneering etc. The last one I had fell in the river with me when I was flyfishing, and it still went on for another 8 months. A long exposure time for night shots is all I really want in addition to existing features.
customer_reviews.author: gilamnstr

customer_reviews.title: Great camera especially when picked up on a 1/2 price ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera especially when picked up on a 1/2 price sale. This camera does everything well and will show you that your Iphone pictures are really not as good as you thought.
customer_reviews.author: Vickym220

customer_reviews.title: Simple, inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice pocket camera. Capabilities far in excess of camera phones and much easier to operate. But if your interest lies in sharing photos over the internet, the Canon Elph 130 adds this worthwhile capability for only a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The item was OK. I bought a plug in charger and it was fine
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Matuszak

customer_reviews.title: Decent pics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to go to India. There are so many things going on, I wanted a camera that would take a pic when I hit the button. This camera was so slow to respond that most of the time what I was photographing was gone. And sometimes it wouldn't even take the pic. Don't waste your time. Pay more for a better camera
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: ELPH: Fits in your pocket and tastes great, too!
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 IS met my requirements for size, weight, picture clarity and built-in features. This camera travels with me daily and the size is perfect. I have been using ELPH cameras for the last 6 years. Did not rate this product for 5 stars due to it's lacking low-light attributes without getting into the additional cost of wifi, and the slippery camera body. The surface of the camera body should be designed with a grippy surface for those of us who might be clumsy.
customer_reviews.author: Esco Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy! The battery has lasted a really long time. I wish it had come with a cord to plug into the computer though. Kinda hard to put pics on there wirthout that, But no biggy I love this camera!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gina heidenreich

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! I have a big DSR but I found that although the picture were beautiful I never took them it was too bog for everyday use! This is perfect I keep it in my purse and never miss a photo op now!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Bought this camera after reading 1 star reviews
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Bought this camera after reading 1 star reviews, which seemed to me too subjective. But after all they reflected the truth. This is not the worst camera in the world, but I've seen better pictures from cell phones.
customer_reviews.author: garciram.wxcgv

customer_reviews.title: Love Canon Powershots!
customer_reviews.text: My young daughter wanted a camera for her birthday, and this one is a perfect fit. It has so many options with easy buttons for her to learn. She would have liked a model with wifi, but the price on this camera couldn't be beat. The blue color is beautiful, and the picture quality is fantastic. Great compact model for anyone to use!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Easy to operate. Gave to friend who has trouble working his computer. Used it on a trip and came back with some great photos.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Roach

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: It the perfect size. It's compact and fits into my small purse easily. And so easy to use. It is basically point and shoot. Did not have to read a manual to start taking pics. The pics I take are crisp and clear. The large 2.7 monitor makes viewing your shots easy. I would recommend this camera to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Suzies Mom

customer_reviews.title: Greatl little camera for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Compact, easy to carry around, takes great photos and short videos. Replaces one my husband lost in the lake because he didn't have the strap around his wrist!
customer_reviews.author: Zanda

customer_reviews.title: compact
customer_reviews.text: Nice small camera for the price. Perfect for those who want an easy inexpensive camera. The enclosed battery charger is compact. The battery is great because it is the same size as the memory cards and fits in most camera cases.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera fire a great price. It takes beautiful pictures and awesome videos. For a pocket camera I think this is the best on the market. I read a lot of reviews looking for the right camera and I believe this is it. No problems to note
customer_reviews.author: Makayla Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, but buy extra cords to connect it to your computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my sister. She was pretty excited until we opened the box and discovered the micro USB cord that you normally use to connect the camera to your computer was not included. I suppose most people just transfer the memory card over, but I like have all the necessary cords in the box.
customer_reviews.author: RJO

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: I got this at Amazon when they were having their pre Christmas sale. It was a great price and has a lot of features. Even though I'll probably never use half of them, it's nice to know that they are there. The 16MP are nice but if you are trying to get a close up on a quarter or dime or something it's gonna be tough (or fuzzy) since that was my original idea being a coin collector. But for taking pictures of everything else this is perfect for it!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to operate and the pictures are great! This little camera is exactly what we wanted. It replaces a Samsung that was similar in features. I am impressed with the clarity of the photos.
customer_reviews.author: nick garciea

customer_reviews.title: Good camera.
customer_reviews.text: Good, everyday camera, at a decent price. Have had no problems, and I notice that the battery lasts a good while. Can put it away in a drawer for a few months, and the battery is still good when I need it. Can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy J.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but my phone takes better pictures. The shutter speed is very slow and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but my phone takes better pictures. The shutter speed is very slow and I found this camera cumbersome to use.
customer_reviews.author: AMG

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Replaces my is780 which was lost. I hope this class of camera does not go away because of cell phone cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Crouch

customer_reviews.title: camera
customer_reviews.text: good little camera. Not as big as i thought it would be but that is all on me for not being exact in researching this. I still like it. Good quality pics, good zoom, and fairly easy to use, even for me;-). Good price for a compact camera.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this little camera
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little camera! It was a cinch to figure out, and has a lot of neat things it can do for such a small and light one. Takes really nice photos too.
customer_reviews.author: yvonne panchot

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for my daughters first trip to europe. She just loves the automatic function, it works well and saves time for amateur users. It's small so she can carry it anywhere. It takes very nice pictures.
customer_reviews.author: pvc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome so far ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old and he loves it. Will update after a while to see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: JohnLuca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect condition got it the same day I ordered it and love it! FANTASTIC PRICE. Broke my previous one by being pulled into a las vegas pool lol so I needed a new one asap. thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Durban

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot Elph 16MP Digital Camera.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small compact, easy to use, quality Digital Camera to carry with me on trips. This camera is loaded with features one would think comes in much higher priced camera's. You can customize your pictures or let the camera do all the settings. It will automatically frame a portrait photo, so you don't have to do anything more than aim and click. You can also make sound video's with this camera. It does it all and with a great reputation for quality products, you cant miss. I highly recommend this Digital Camera for the amateur to the professional photographer.
customer_reviews.author: Harley H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Wow have the prices of camera's come down the last few years. Not a ton of features, but great little camera with Canon's excellent build quality. For the price, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Delana Patnode

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal - great camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought one last year for my mom. This year I found it as a "Deal of the Day" and it was a great deal. This is the best camera for point and shoot. I bought it for my teen and he has taken the best photos of friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Bbrl00

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. It is light & compact, can easily slip it into your pocket & take it anywhere. No more "I wish I had my camera with me moments." Takes a great clear picture, even in low light. Bright colors. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: ... little more complicated than he thought but he was happy with the results
customer_reviews.text: boyfriend said it was a little more complicated than he thought but he was happy with the results
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo Padgett

customer_reviews.title: awesome deal, only con it doesn't look I can ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome deal, only con it doesn't look I can charge from USB cable, It will only re-charge using the provided battery charger (so I have to remove the battery each time)
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Stermieri

customer_reviews.title: Good at kids/pets photos were the subject is moving
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this camera. The other Canon I had could not take a decent photo if there was even the slightest movement by the subject. This one does much better with that.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Canon cameras rock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for when I don't want to lug around my T3i, but want better pics than a smartphone can offer. This camera is incredibly light and takes great no-brainer shots, exactly what a point-and-shoot should be.
customer_reviews.author: Standoffish Dan

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic LITTLE Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't really in the market for a new camera, but I came across this little Elph on Amazon for $69, and I couldn't resist! It takes wonderful pictures, and it is really TINY, and it fits in a purse or pocket nicely! I definitely do not regret this purchase at all... and one of the best things is that it is pink!
customer_reviews.author: L. Haerens

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Always liked Canon products, and was not disappointed with this one. I got it to replace my original ELPH from about 10 years ago (which still works but not as many pixels). This camera is more plastic, but just as good.
customer_reviews.author: chaosweb

customer_reviews.title: Takes ok shots. Nothing special from any other point ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes ok shots. Nothing special from any other point and shoot camera. A little grainy, but that could be from me using a DSLR camera along side this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice and small
customer_reviews.text: There were times when it was windy and the camera took great pics. Colors are so vivid. Love this little camera. Fits into my small purse without taking too much room. Highly recommend for a small camera.
customer_reviews.author: bjs

customer_reviews.title: Nice Point-and-Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife and she loves it. Takes great pictures. No "cons" at all. Arrived expeditiously and received as described.
customer_reviews.author: poo

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just the right size to slip in a small clutch purse or a pocket. My only complaint is that there was no adjustment bead on the strap. My husband's old one did. It makes it much safer to be able to secure it to your wrist while taking pictures from the back of the motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: Love the color. Works great. Only with it was a little bigger. Have had the brand for years. Never fails me.
customer_reviews.author: rebecca fleming

customer_reviews.title: It takes great pictures and I find that I use it more ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive camera and chose this one. It takes great pictures and I find that I use it more than my Canon Rebel.
customer_reviews.author: KB3

customer_reviews.title: This is my pride and my joy and do not know what I would do without ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my pride and my joy and do not know what I would do without it. It stays on my purse and very handy. fits in case perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Great small camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted small and capable, and that's what I got. Several gripes include difficulty in achieving the close-up lens unless the ambient light is really, really bright; and printing the manual is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mckay

customer_reviews.title: canon elph
customer_reviews.text: cute, small, not as easy to use as my 3 year old power shot. for all the advertised features the camera came with next to zero operating instructions. have tried figuring a few things out, had one of my techie students play with it. offered it to him and he turned it down.... his phone camera takes better pictures.should have returned. probably toss in donation box. next camera probably won't be canon, or ordered (physical) sight unseen.i doubt this gets posted.... shame.
customer_reviews.author: pamela sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Newest version to my ELPH cameras
customer_reviews.text: As a Director of a Preschool where 3 and 4 year olds are our population, the ELPH 115 is great! I have 2 others of a previous generation and all are performing amazingly well! I'm going on a short trip in two weeks and will take the 115 with me as I enjoy some away with nature time! It is easy to pack in purse or day-pack and super easy to use with great results!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Purchased As Gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera as a gift for my son and he says thst he couldn't be happier with it. It takes great pictures. I'm considering purchasing one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth "Liz"

customer_reviews.title: I have had older ELPH cameras and like them for their simplicity and resulting good photos
customer_reviews.text: I have had older ELPH cameras and like them for their simplicity and resulting good photos. This one is at a good price point now that a newer model is available, and I cannot see why one would pay more for what is essentially a point-and-shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moran

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, good crsip clear pictures, easy to operate, also nice and compact. If you're not the best picture-taker, then get this camera, because it will make it easy for oyuand you'll enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: lezzah

customer_reviews.title: nice little camera
customer_reviews.text: nice little camera, doesn't come with cords for computer, but it did not claim too. the cord is only 5 bucks on amazon so no worries. fits right in my purse
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This has no interesting features on it. My 5MP phone camera seems to do better pictures than this. I know this is a pretty cheap camera, but it really shows that it is cheap: the screen resolution seems pretty low, focus seems to be off or not consistent, and doesn't feel very user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Comfort

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to carry in my purse that takes good pictures and this is the perfect camera. It takes great pictures for the price. I'm satisfied. Also I like the fact that you can recharge it and not have to buy batteries for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: This little camera works as advertised. The instructions are comprehensible and make the camera easy to use. I would recommend to anyone that needs a small camera to carry with them.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 115 16MP Digital Camera (Blue) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:Blue| Style:Body OnlyPowerShot ELPH 115 IS is equipped with a powerful 8x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle lens and the 16.0 Megapixel sensor with DIGIC 4 Image Processor deliver sharp resolution and beautifully accurate color. Smart AUTO makes high quality easy in any situation by choosing optimal camera settings perfect for 32 recognized scenes. Your memories live on in sharp, true-to-life 720p HD video, and recording starts with a simple push of a button. Intelligent IS eliminates blur by automatically choosing image stabilization that's right for the shooting situation. And now you'll shoot longer thanks to the new ECO Mode, which reduces power consumption. Focal Length: 5 - 40 mm.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 


CAPTURE MOMENTS WITH SOPHISTICATION
This is an ELPH you'll want in your pocket every day: easy to use and sleekly stylish, the PowerShot ELPH 115 IS is equipped to turn any moment into a high-quality image. The bright, powerful 8x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle lens takes you up close for detail and out wide for group shots, while the 16.0 Megapixel sensor and DIGIC 4 Image Processor deliver sharp resolution and beautifully accurate color. And now you'll shoot longer thanks to the new ECO Mode, which reduces power consumption. Smart AUTO makes high quality easy in any situation by choosing optimal camera settings perfect for 32 recognized scenes. Your memories live on in sharp, true-to-life 720p HD video, and recording starts with a simple push of a button. Intelligent IS eliminates blur by automatically choosing image stabilization that's right for the shooting situation.

GIVE IMAGES A WHOLE NEW PERSPECTIVE
8X OPTICAL ZOOM WITH 28MM WIDE-ANGLE LENS
The PowerShot ELPH 115 IS features a powerful Genuine Canon 8x Zoom Lens that delivers outstanding optical performance and versatility. Fitting a high-performance lens with such wide zoom range into a camera so thin would normally be considered an impossible feat but Canon's expert optical engineering met the challenge, developing a lens that achieves outstanding compactness with high zoom power and superb performance. The zoom starts at 28mm wide-angle and extends to 224mm telephoto (35mm equivalent), covering an exceptionally wide range. The telephoto reach gives you the freedom to capture subjects from a considerable distance, while the 28mm wide-angle makes it easy to shoot sweeping landscapes, large groups of people and tall buildings.

HIGH RESOLUTION, HIGHLY ADVANCED PERFORMANCE
16.0 MEGAPIXEL SENSOR
With the camera's 16.0 Megapixels of resolution, your images are rich and clear, with textures and tiny details faithfully reproduced even at the long end of the big 8x Optical Zoom. This high level of resolution is ideal for creating the largest prints, and allows you the flexibility to blow up and crop any section of an image to express your creativity. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor powers the camera's advanced systems and features, ensuring fast, reliable performance with low battery consumption.

DIGIC 4 IMAGE PROCESSOR
Canon DIGIC Image Processors have set the standard for functionality and performance since their groundbreaking introduction in 1999. With each successive generation, DIGIC processors have brought elevated performance and powerful new features to PowerShot digital cameras. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor has ushered in a new level of picture quality and accelerated processing, making possible features such as high-speed continuous shooting, HD video and Face Detection Self-timer.

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS
SMART AUTO
Photographers of all levels appreciate a camera – especially a go-anywhere compact digital – that takes the hassle out of capturing beautiful images. The PowerShot ELPH 115 IS digital camera gives you Smart AUTO – sophisticated Canon technology that makes getting that great shot as simple as pressing the shutter button. Smart AUTO automatically detects scenes by assessing various factors in both the background and the subject. Detected scenes are analyzed using 32 predefined shooting situations. The camera then makes optimal settings to ensure the best possible image capture when shooting still images. Smart AUTO also includes Advanced Subject Detection, which allows the camera to detect and track non-human moving subjects like animals and vehicles. With Smart AUTO, all you have to do is frame your shot and capture away.

SHOOTING MODES/SPECIAL SCENE MODES
Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography. Stitch Assist Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. GORGEOUS HD VIDEO FROM YOUR STILL CAMERA
SHOOT BRILLIANT 720P HD VIDEO
You can shoot high definition video anytime, anywhere, with the pocket-sized PowerShot ELPH 115 IS. With a simple push of the dedicated movie button, you'll be able to instantly record every moment in motion. 720p HD video is smooth, vivid, and beautifully lifelike, making it an ideal way to capture special memories. In addition to being able to shoot 720p HD video at 25 frames per second, the PowerShot ELPH 115 IS can also shoot 640 x 480 VGA video at 30* frames per second.

*Actual frame rate is 29.97 fps.

DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON FOR EASY VIDEO CAPTURE
It's never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. To make shooting video as natural as snapping pictures, the PowerShot ELPH 115 IS has a dedicated movie button. No need to plan ahead, no need to search through menus on the LCD screen; when you feel a moment would be best captured in 720p HD, simply press the button and recording begins. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want.

A STEADY IMAGE IS A BEAUTIFUL IMAGE
INTELLIGENT IS AUTOMATICALLY CHOOSES FROM SIX DIFFERENT MODES TO OPTIMIZE IMAGE STABILIZATION FOR THE SHOOTING CONDITION
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot ELPH 115 IS, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. A CHARGE THAT LASTS AS LONG AS A MEMORY
NEW ECO MODE HELPS REDUCE POWER CONSUMPTION FOR LONGER BATTERY LIFE
The PowerShot ELPH 115 IS takes energy conservation to the next level with ECO Mode, which provides more shots per single charge through LCD monitor and camera power management. ECO Mode can be activated for easy power preservation when an outlet is unavailable or the moment is too exciting to put the camera down. ECO Mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed so you won't miss the moment. When the fun with family and friends runs late into the evening, ECO Mode on the PowerShot ELPH 115 IS makes sure your camera keeps up.
feature_bullets: 16.0 MP sensor with DIGIC 4 Image Processor
5x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle lens with Digital IS to reduce camera shake
Smart AUTO with 32 predefined shooting modes
720p HD video recording with a dedicated movie button
New ECO Mode to reduce power consumption

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars654 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
